div.p: Life outside of work... To be honest I would say it's a positive thing, I mean my family are proud, my friends are proud; I am also a DJ as well
so doing the shifts it sort of helps me because I get a lot of time off at the same time, well rest periods I should put it,
so no it doesn’t really affect me in a negative way if anything it’s in a positive way because I do 2 things with my life that I both enjoy.
I mean you know I drive a nice car and stuff like that, I mean kids come up to me “that’s that DJ money” I’m like “no it’s Fire Fighter money”
to make them see that you know you go for something like that it can get you places so in that respect I’d say that’s the best decision
I’ve made and that is, I get more satisfaction in that than even saving people it’s the reaction I get just being in the community
they sort of hold me with high regard and I do feel proud for it.
Obviously I’ve got to be careful what I do on the outside of my job I mean for instance I came off a motorbike a few years ago
and that took me out of my job for about 6 or 7 months so that had a huge impact I mean I was still able to do alternative duties
but it did leave me to worry, you know, what would happen if it had been much worse? So yeah I don’t know it can be a scary question
but maybe that’s just how I think, I think if something was to stop me from doing my job health-wise as in an injury or even fitness
straight away I’d think “have I still got a job?” when really I should be thinking, I should make adjustments but that’s just
how I think so, no, health-wise I just try and keep to tune really.
